Yes, on linux pre-NPTL, each java thread shows as its own process 
(Config. out of the box has 50 threads start).  The way java heap works 
is that it will start at a minimum size and grow to an upper bound as it 
needs the extra space.  Out of the box, heritrix specifies an upper 
bound of 256megs with no specification of initial heap size; it'll be 
JVM dependent (64megs on linux with SUN JVM is what I seem to remember, 
but I could be wrong).

You didn't doctor the bin/heritrix script or override JAVA_OPTS?  If 
not, you should be seeing max heap size 256megs in web UI for that is 
what the bin/heritrix script stipulates, not 64megs.

I can't explain why your linux is showing such odd numbers for JVM 
usage.  It looks right in mine (Debian 2.4.22).  Maybe someone else can 
say why.
